DOC.brief_summary: The two objective study evaluate long-term efficacy safety adalimumab treatment participant moderate severe chronic plaque psoriasis evaluate effectiveness adalimumab retreatment participant therapeutic response adalimumab withdrawn adalimumab treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Adalimumab Subjects With Moderate Severe Chronic Plaque Psoriasis
DOC.detailed_description: Study M03-658 continuation study participant moderate severe psoriasis participate prior psoriasis adalimumab study . Study M03-658 consist three sequential treatment period . The first period Period O , participant receive open-label treatment adalimumab ( 40 mg every week 40 mg every week ) minimum 104 week maximum 252 week . Period O period study May 2008 , subsequent period add via amendment protocol . At time , participant achieve satisfactory therapeutic response ( Physician 's Global Assessment [ PGA ] 0 , 1 , 2 [ clear , minimal , mild ] ) give opportunity discontinue study continue participate subsequent two period . The second period Period W , maximum 52 week , participant PGA 2 ( mild ) less withdrawn adalimumab treatment ( i.e. , participant receive treatment ) relapse psoriasis occur ( define PGA 3 [ moderate ] worse ) . The third period Period R , 16-week period participant retreat open-label adalimumab ( 80 mg initial dose follow 40 mg every week ) . Period O design evaluate first objective regard long-term efficacy safety adalimumab treatment , Period R design evaluate effectiveness adalimumab retreatment follow relapse . Specific subset study population identify population interest modify intent-to-treat population Period W Period R , describe outcome measure .
DOC.criteria: Subject age 18 old good health ( Investigator discretion ) recent stable medical history . Subjects met requirement previous adalimumab psoriasis study participation . Subject consider Investigator , reason , unsuitable candidate study . Female subject pregnant breastfeeding consider become pregnant .
